alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 1:57PM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Porter, Humble, Sheldon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 50.3 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as homes on Lake Point Drive in the Northshore subdivision begin flooding and roads in the Bellaeu Woods subdivision are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 50.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CDT Wednesday was 51.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 46.1 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.1 feet on 06/21/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 50.1 Wed 12 pm CD 48.3 47.1 46.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 800 AM CDT.
